result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie Jernigan

records.addlTxt: Status conference date was entered incorrectly; correct date is November 28, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Valerie Jernigan in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Valerie Jernigan.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 02/03/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Valerie Jernigan appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Valerie Jernigan.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and offer and requested projected plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Valerie Jernigan in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S.Suvaka.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Valerie Jernigan in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Valerie Jernigan in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Valerie Jernigan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
